#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent

#Summary1=(human1) This guide to washing overalls suggests washing them with like clothing, avoiding clothes which can get twisted up with the straps, fastening straps to the bib with twist ties (also in the dryer), emptying pockets, moving the strap adjusters to make them last longer, using less detergent if washing overalls alone, and taking care plastic ties don't melt in the dryer.

#Summary2=(human2) This instructional article explains that when washing overalls in a washing machine, one should wash them with like articles or alone, with the straps fastened and secured with twist ties, with the pockets empty, and with the strap adjusters moved to distribute the wear and tear of washing.

#Summary3=(human3) This guide explains that to save time, prevent wear, and extend the life of the overalls, you should wash overalls only with other denim and canvas clothing, fasten the straps to the bib with twist ties, empty the pockets, move the strap adjusters, use half the detergent and less water if washing alone or in a light load, and leave the straps fastened to the bib when drying.

#Summary4=(human4) This guide outlines how to wash overalls in a washing machine with like items but nothing that will get tangled in the straps, making sure to fasten the bib and zip tie the straps fastened, empty the pockets, move the adjusters, and wash with less detergent and water while remembering that paper zip ties may deteriorate in the wash but plastic ones may melt in the dryer.

#Summary5=(human5) This guide walks through how to wash overalls so that the straps do not wear out, including using plastic or paper twist ties to fasten the straps, emptying all the pockets before washing, and moving the strap adjusters around to distribute the wear and tear of washing on the straps.
#Text=How to Wash Overalls in a Washing Machine
#Text=Whether you are a working man or just a little cutie trying to stay cute , those overalls are going to need washing sooner or later .
#Text=The straps on adults ’ overalls often get so twisted during the wash that one wishes she had just used an old fashioned washboard instead .
#Text=Your appliances are also murder on the straps , which are almost always the first things to wear out on your overalls .
#Text=This article will show you how to save time and prevent wear , extending the life of your overalls until they are so soft you could wear them to bed .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Wash alone or with " like " clothing .
#Text=It ’s best to wash adults ’ overalls alone , especially men ’s .
#Text=However , it is okay to wash just a few items with them , like blue jeans .
#Text=What you do n’t want to wash with them is anything that can get twisted up with the straps , like women ’s long sleeve shirts or kids ’ blankets .
#Text=Think similar clothing , minus the twisty-ness .
#Text=Just do the denim and canvas stuff together .
#Text=Fasten the straps to the bib .
#Text=If you did n’t know already , the bib is the top front part with the breast pockets .
#Text=Go ahead and fasten both straps before you wash .
#Text=This will help keep them from twisting up during the wash .
#Text=Use twist ties to keep the straps fastened .
#Text=This step will reapportion years of your life in the long run .
#Text=Do n’t skip it .
#Text=Take the 20 seconds to use a couple twist ties on the fasteners to make sure they do n’t come loose .
#Text=If your washing machine is worth its salt , it will undo those straps in a heartbeat and tie them in a sheet bend unless you prevent it .
#Text=All it takes is two twist ties and a few seconds of patience .
#Text=Empty the pockets .
#Text=Overalls have more pockets than pants .
#Text=The bib has a wallet pocket and a watch pocket .
#Text=Kids put rocks , candy , and bugs in these .
#Text=Men put cell phones and small tools in them .
#Text=Women defy the laws of purse - space , so when it comes to bib pockets , the sky is the limit .
#Text=Make sure all the pockets are empty .
#Text=Move the strap adjusters around .
#Text=You ’ve probably got them just the way you like them , but if you move the adjusters up or down on the straps occasionally , the straps will last longer .
#Text=Depending on the adjusters , you may be able to leave them a little loose too .
#Text=The straps wear out fastest around the adjusters over the course of numerous wash and dry cycles ( not to mention being out in the elements if they are work clothes ) .
#Text=Moving them distributes the wear and tear of washing .
#Text=This is the same idea as rotating tires .
#Text=You know about rotating your tires , do n't you ?
#Text=Tips
#Text=If you wash your overalls alone or in a light load , use about half the detergent called for and less water .
#Text=Leave the straps fastened and twist - tied to the bib when you throw them in the dryer .
#Text=This will cut down on some of the racket , but you 're still going to hear them .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=The paper - type twist ties will deteriorate a little , but the dryer filter screen will catch the fallout .
#Text=Plastic - type twist ties will hold up in the wash , but may or may not melt in your dryer .
#Text=Use with caution .
